sentences.sentence: The giant( 巨人 ) did not know what to say. He found it hard to believe that the little man had squeezed( 挤出 ) water from the “stone.”
Then the giant took up a stone, and threw it so high that it was nearly out of sight.
“Now, little one, do that!”
“Well thrown,” said the tailor( 裁缝 ), “but the stone fell back to earth again. I will throw you one that will never come back.”
So he felt in his pocket, took out the bird, and threw it into the air.
And the bird, when it found itself free, flew up into the sky and never returned.
“What do you think of that, friend?” asked the tailor.
“There is no doubt that you can throw,” said the giant, “but we will see if you can carry.”
He led the little tailor to a very large tree which had been cut down, and was lying on the ground, and said,
“Now, if you are strong enough, help me to carry this tree out of the wood.”
“Willingly,” answered the little man, “you take the trunk( 树干 ), I will take the branches( 树枝 ) with all their leaves, that is much the most difficult part.”
So the giant took the trunk on his shoulders, and the tailor seated himself on a branch.
The giant, who could not see what was happening behind him, had to carry the whole tree, and the little man on it as well.
And the little man was very cheerful and merry( 快乐的 ), and whistled( 吹口哨 ) the tune( 调子 ): “There were three tailors riding by,” as if carrying the tree was mere child’s play.
The giant, when he had struggled( 艰难行进 ) on under his heavy load( 负重 ) a part of the way, was tired out, and cried,
“I need a rest. I can’t carry this tree any further!”
The tailor jumped off quickly, and taking hold of the tree with both arms, as if he were carrying it, said to the giant,
“Even though you are so big, you can’t carry this tree as far as I can!”
They went on together a little further, and came to a cherry( 樱桃 ) tree.
The giant took hold of the highest branches, where the ripest( 最成熟的 ) fruit hung.
He pulled them downward and gave them to the tailor to hold, inviting him to eat.
But of course the little tailor was much too small and light to hold the tree.
So when the giant let go, the tree sprang back, and the tailor was thrown up into the air.
And when he dropped down again without any damage( 损伤 ), the giant said to him,
“Haven’t your strength enough to hold even a weak little tree like that?”
“It is not a question of strength,” answered the little tailor.
“How could it be, to one who has killed seven at one blow! I just jumped over the tree because the hunters( 猎人 ) are shooting at us from those bushes( 灌木丛 ). You jump too, if you can.”
The giant made the attempt, and not being able to jump over the tree, he got stuck in the branches( 树枝 ), so that the tailor again seemed to be the better man.
Then the giant said,
“Since you are such a strong man, why don’t you come with me to the cave( 洞穴 ) where we giants live, and stay the night?”
The tailor was quite willing, and followed him.
When they reached the cave, there were some other giants sitting by the fire.
Each had a roasted( 被烤的 ) sheep in his hand, and was eating it.
The little tailor looked round and thought,
“There is much more room here than in my workshop( 作坊 ).”
The giant showed him a bed, and told him to lie down upon it and go to sleep.
But the bed was too big for the tailor, so he did not stay in it, but went into a corner to sleep.
At midnight the giant got up, picked up a great iron bar( 条状物 ), and hit the bed with it as hard as he could.
Of course he assumed( 想当然地认为 ) that he had killed the tailor.
Very early in the morning the giants went into the wood and forgot all about the little tailor.
Then, when they saw him coming after them, still alive and healthy, they were terribly frightened( 害怕的 ).
They thought he was going to kill them, so they ran away quickly.

article_info.previous: 小裁缝买了一些果酱抹到面包上，果酱的甜美吸引了很多苍蝇，小裁缝一下打死了七只。激动不已的小裁缝想要走出小作坊到更大的世界去宣扬自己的事迹。并邀请在山顶遇到的巨人一同寻找成功之路。
article_info.share_words: Then the giant took up a stone, and threw it so high that it was nearly out of sight.

question.cn: 小裁缝把什么东西扔向天空？
question.en: What did the little tailor throw into the air?

analysis: 文中提到：“So he felt in his pocket, took out the bird, and threw it into the air.”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 当巨人放手后，发生了什么？
question.en: What happened when the giant let go？

options.en: The tailor was thrown up into the air.

analysis: 文中提到：“So when the giant let go, the tree sprang back, and the tailor was thrown up into the air.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 当巨人们看到小裁缝仍然活着是何感受？
question.en: How were the giants when they saw the tailor still alive?

analysis: 文中提到：“Then, when they saw him coming after them, still alive and healthy, they were terribly frightened.” 因此答案选B。
